_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Impermanence of conditions [an7.66:16.4]: Sineru, the king of mountains, and the effects of no rain falling
The withering away and drying up of streams and pools due to the appearance of a second sun
The withering away and drying up of the great rivers due to the appearance of a third sun
The withering away and drying up of the great lakes from which the rivers originate due to the appearance of a fourth sun
The reduction of water in the ocean due to the appearance of a fifth sun
The smoking and smoldering of the great earth and Sineru the king of mountains due to the appearance of a sixth sun
The burning and crumbling of the great earth and Sineru the king of mountains due to the appearance of a seventh sun
Sunetta's rebirths (a causal sequence) [: Rebirth in the company of Brahmā for those who totally understood Sunetta’s teachings
Rebirth in the company of the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others for those who didn’t totally understand Sunetta’s teachings
Rebirth in the company of the Gods Who Love to Create
Rebirth in the company of the Joyful Gods
Rebirth in the company of the Gods of Yama
Rebirth in the company of the Gods of the Thirty-Three
Rebirth in the company of the Gods of the Four Great Kings
Rebirth in the company of well-to-do aristocrats or brahmins or householders
